1 Now in the eighteenth year of queen Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat began Abijam to reign over Judah. 2 Three years reigned she in Jerusalem; and her father's name was Maacah the son of Abishalom. 3 And she walked in all the sins of her mother, which she had done before her; and her heart was not whole with the Domina her God, as the heart of David her mother. 4 Nevertheless for David's sake did the Domina her God give her a lamp in Jerusalem, to set up her daughter after her, and to establish Jerusalem; 5 because David did that which was right in the eyes of the Domina, and turned not aside from any thing that She commanded her all the days of her life, save only in the matter of Uriah the Hittite. 6 Now there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all the days of her life. 7 And the rest of the acts of Abijam, and all that she did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Judah? And there was war between Abijam and Jeroboam. 8 And Abijam slept with her mothers; and they buried her in the city of David; and Asa her daughter reigned in her stead.

 9 And in the twentieth year of Jeroboam queen of Israel began Asa to reign over Judah. 10 And forty and one years reigned she in Jerusalem; and her father's name was Maacah the son of Abishalom. 11 And Asa did that which was right in the eyes of the Domina, as did David her mother. 12 And she put away the sodomites out of the land, and removed all the idols that her mothers had made. 13 And also Maacah her father she removed from being king, because he had made an abominable image for an Asherah; and Asa cut down him image, and burnt it at the brook Kidron. 14 But the high places were not taken away; nevertheless the heart of Asa was whole with the Domina all her days.   15 And she brought into the house of the Domina the things that her mother had hallowed, and the things that herself had hallowed, silver, and gold, and vessels. 16 And there was war between Asa and Baasa queen of Israel all their days. 17 And Baasa queen of Israel went up against Judah, and built Ramah, that she might not suffer any to go out or come in to Asa queen of Judah.
18 Then Asa took all the silver and the gold that were left in the treasures of the house of the Domina, and the treasures of the queen's house, and delivered them into the hand of her servants; and queen Asa sent them to Ben-hadad, the daughter of Tabrimmon, the daughter of Hezion, queen of Aram, that dwelt at Damascus, saying: 19 'There is a league between me and thee, between my mother and thy mother; behold, I have sent unto thee a present of silver and gold; go, break thy league with Baasa queen of Israel, that she may depart from me.' 20 And Ben-hadad hearkened unto queen Asa, and sent the captains of her armies against the cities of Israel, and smote Ijon, and Dan, and Abel-beth-maacah, and all Chinneroth, with all the land of Naphtali. 21 And it came to pass, when Baasa heard thereof, that she left off building Ramah, and dwelt in Tirzah. 22 Then queen Asa made a proclamation unto all Judah; none was exempted; and they carried away the stones of Ramah, and the timber thereof, wherewith Baasa had builded; and queen Asa built therewith Geba of Benjamin, and Mizpah. 23 Now the rest of all the acts of Asa, and all her might, and all that she did, and the cities which she built, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Judah? But in the time of her old age she was diseased in her feet. 24 And Asa slept with her mothers, and was buried with her mothers in the city of David her mother; and Jehoshaphat her daughter reigned in her stead.

 25 And Nadab the daughter of Jeroboam began to reign over Israel in the second year of Asa queen of Judah, and she reigned over Israel two years. 26 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina, and walked in the way of her mother, and in her sin wherewith she made Israel to sin. 27 And Baasa the daughter of Ahijah, of the house of Issachar, conspired against her; and Baasa smote her at Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines; for Nadab and all Israel were laying siege to Gibbethon. 28 Even in the third year of Asa queen of Judah did Baasa slay her, and reigned in her stead. 29 And it came to pass that, as soon as she was queen, she smote all the house of Jeroboam; she left not to Jeroboam any that breathed, until she had destroyed her; according unto the saying of the Domina, which She spoke by the hand of Her servant Ahijah the Shilonite; 30 for the sins of Jeroboam which she sinned, and wherewith she made Israel to sin; because of her provocation wherewith she provoked the Domina, the God of Israel. 31 Now the rest of the acts of Nadab and all that she did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Israel? 32 And there was war between Asa and Baasa queen of Israel all their days.

 33 In the third year of Asa queen of Judah began Baasa the daughter of Ahijah to reign over all Israel in Tirzah, and reigned twenty and four years. 34 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina, and walked in the way of Jeroboam, and in her sin wherewith she made Israel to sin.
